description: A quick, practical guide to The Legacy of Psychoanalysis.

buildup.text: Psychoanalysis dominated psychology for decades and transformed how Western culture thinks about the mind.

discovery.text: It introduced therapy, the talking cure, and the revolutionary idea that understanding the past heals the present.

twist.text: As a science, psychoanalysis was largely unfalsifiable â€” its claims couldn't be tested or disproven.

climax.text: Modern psychotherapy descended from psychoanalysis but evolved toward evidence-based, testable approaches.

punchline.text: Psychoanalysis got the culture right and the science wrong.

quiz.question: What was a major scientific criticism of psychoanalysis?
options: It relied too much on controlled experiments
